creator: sdeuvarow@gmail.com
text:
I made a JDBC sampler with this statement:
SELECT * FROM factura WHERE CI = '${CI}'  AND CI_Vendedor = '${CI_Vendedor}';

Where, CI and CI_Vendedor are variables that i get from a CSV file.
I run the same testPlan in an older version of JMeter, and it works.

This is the request that JMeter sends to the database:
[Prepared Select Statement] SELECT *  FROM factura WHERE CI = '${CI}'  AND
CI_Vendedor = '${CI_Vendedor}';
Request Headers:

In the JMeter 2.2 the request is:
[Select Statement] SELECT *  FROM factura WHERE CI = '3'  AND CI_Vendedor = '1';
Request Headers:

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Works OK for me in 2.2 and current nightly.

Check the jmeter log file for any error messages - perhaps the CSV data file 
cannot be found (in the test plan it has a trailing \ which looks wrong).

(In reply to comment #2)
> Works OK for me in 2.2 and current nightly.
> 
> Check the jmeter log file for any error messages - perhaps the CSV data file 
> cannot be found (in the test plan it has a trailing \ which looks wrong).

Yes, this was the error. The file path wasn´t recognized.
But i found another thing. Sometimes, i made modifications on the sampler values
(change the file path in a CSV Config, or change the SQL in the JDBC Sampler),
and then i save the test plan.. but the sampler don´t save the changes. 
If i click another element in the tree and then click back the changes did not
appear.

1- New Test Plan
2- add thread group
3- add a csv data set config
4- change the file name, variable names and delimiter
5- save test plan in some directory
6- change the filename
7- click on thread group element
8- click back on the csv data set config
 -> see change didn´t was taken.
creator: sdeuvarow@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text: Please open a new bug for a new problem.
